intro: Hedlundia subarranensis, commonly known as the Armenian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, preferring well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Hedlundia subarranensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
